Description: Neck and shoulder sherd of Milesian Fikellura pottery neck-amphora; glaze fired orange-brown; dull cream slip; exterior: bottom of neck glazed; on shoulder file of water birds to right (chest, neck and head of bird; second is complete; tail feather and one leg of third); triple dot rosette as filling ornament; below, part of billet pattern frieze.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 36, no. 8, pl. XVIII, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GF.027)
Schlotzhauer 2012 / Untersuchungen zur archaischen griechischen Keramik aus Naukratis (p. 139-40, Nau 106, pl. 23d-e)
